abstract: Damascus Journal; Damascus, Syria, is shielded from worst of country's turmoil, but its residents are tired of constant fighting and yearn for normal life as war drags on for sixth year; in effort to maintain routine, wealthy continue to gather at plush restaurants and bars in downtown districts while city's opera house and television studios still launch productions.
lead_paragraph: Declan Walsh provides an on-the-ground report from Syria’s capital, where residents, spared the worst of the violence, respond to a seemingly interminable war with skepticism and dark humor.

headline.main: On Streets of Syria’s Capital, Even the Sweet Is Sour
headline.print_headline: Worn by War Yet Yearning for Normal

snippet: Declan Walsh provides an on-the-ground report from Syria’s capital, where residents, spared the worst of the violence, respond to a seemingly interminable war with skepticism and dark humor.
